items.title: Awesome Tall Stack
items.content_text:
### Examples

*   üîì [aw-studio.de](https://aw-studio.de/) - [repository](https://github.com/aw-studio/aw-studio.de) - Built using Laravel & Tailwind CSS.
*   üîì [driesvints.com](https://driesvints.com) - [repository (‚≠ê74)](https://github.com/driesvints/driesvints.com) - Built using Laravel & Tailwind CSS.
*   üîì [fullstackbelgium.be](https://fullstackbelgium.be) - [repository (‚≠ê17)](https://github.com/fullstackbelgium/fullstackbelgium.be) - Built using Laravel & Tailwind CSS.
*   üîì [fullstackeurope.com](https://fullstackeurope.com) - [repository (‚≠ê39)](https://github.com/fullstackeurope/fullstackeurope.com) - Built using Laravel, Alpine.js & Tailwind CSS.
*   üîì [novapackages.com](https://novapackages.com) - [repository (‚≠ê337)](https://github.com/tightenco/novapackages) - Discover new Laravel Nova packages.
*   üîê [pingping.io](https://pingping.io?ref=awesome-tall-stack) - Website uptime && SSL monitoring.
items.content_html:

items.title: Awesome Blazor
items.content_text:
### Tools & Utilities / Others

*   [Blazor I18n/Localization Text (‚≠ê275)](https://github.com/jsakamoto/Toolbelt.Blazor.I18nText) - ![stars](https://img.shields.io/github/stars/jsakamoto/Toolbelt.Blazor.I18nText?style=flat-square\&cacheSeconds=604800) ![last commit](https://img.shields.io/github/last-commit/jsakamoto/Toolbelt.Blazor.I18nText?style=flat-square\&cacheSeconds=86400) Localizing contents text in Blazor ([Demo](https://jsakamoto.github.io/Toolbelt.Blazor.I18nText/)).
*   [MvvmBlazor (‚≠ê244)](https://github.com/klemmchr/MvvmBlazor) - ![stars](https://img.shields.io/github/stars/klemmchr/MvvmBlazor?style=flat-square\&cacheSeconds=604800) ![last commit](https://img.shields.io/github/last-commit/klemmchr/MvvmBlazor?style=flat-square\&cacheSeconds=86400) BlazorMVVM is a small framework for building Blazor and BlazorServerside apps. With it's simple to use MVVM pattern you can boost up your development speed while minimizing the hazzle to just make it work.
items.content_html:
Tools & Utilities / Others

  • Blazor I18n/Localization Text (‚≠ê275) - Localizing contents text in Blazor (Demo).
  • MvvmBlazor (‚≠ê244) - BlazorMVVM is a small framework for building Blazor and BlazorServerside apps. With it's simple to use MVVM pattern you can boost up your development speed while minimizing the hazzle to just make it work.

items.title: Awesome Engineering Team Management
items.content_text:
### Career / Presentations

*   [My questions for prospective employers (Director/VP roles)](https://jacobian.org/2019/apr/23/questions-for-employers-director-vp/) - Be prepared to ask them as a recruiter or being asked about them for senior management roles.

### Career / Performance Reviews

*   [Incentive Pay Considered Harmful](https://www.joelonsoftware.com/2000/04/03/incentive-pay-considered-harmful/) - ‚ÄúIncentives (or bribes) simply can't work in the workplace. (‚Ä¶) Most software managers have no choice but to go along with performance review systems that are already in place. If you're in this position, the only way to prevent teamicide is to simply give everyone on your team a gushing review‚Äù.
*   ‚ÄúIf anything in your performance review is a surprise, then I have failed as a manager.‚Äù ([source](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=17249767)).
*   ‚ÄúThis is what I loved about working at Netflix. We didn't have performance reviews. It was assumed that your performance was good to excellent, otherwise you wouldn't be working there anymore. You had a constant feedback loop with your manager on performance, but nothing was ever formal.‚Äù ([source](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=23861960)).
*   ‚ÄúThe system a software developer works in shapes their performance so much more than individual differences.‚Äù ([source](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=21972033)).
items.content_html:
Career / Presentations

  • My questions for prospective employers (Director/VP roles) - Be prepared to ask them as a recruiter or being asked about them for senior management roles.

Career / Performance Reviews

  • Incentive Pay Considered Harmful - ‚ÄúIncentives (or bribes) simply can't work in the workplace. (‚Ä¶) Most software managers have no choice but to go along with performance review systems that are already in place. If you're in this position, the only way to prevent teamicide is to simply give everyone on your team a gushing review‚Äù.
  • ‚ÄúIf anything in your performance review is a surprise, then I have failed as a manager.‚Äù (source).
  • ‚ÄúThis is what I loved about working at Netflix. We didn't have performance reviews. It was assumed that your performance was good to excellent, otherwise you wouldn't be working there anymore. You had a constant feedback loop with your manager on performance, but nothing was ever formal.‚Äù (source).
  • ‚ÄúThe system a software developer works in shapes their performance so much more than individual differences.‚Äù (source).

items.title: Webcomponents the Right Way
items.content_text:
### Case Studies

*   [Web Development At Scale: Composable Applications With Web Components](https://medium.com/@jarrodek/composable-applications-with-web-components-ebe5158387be)

### Components

*   [`<api-viewer>`](https://github.com/web-padawan/api-viewer-element) - API documentation and live playground for Web Components.
*   [`<chess-board>`](https://github.com/justinfagnani/chessboard-element) - Standalone chess board web component.
*   [`<css-doodle>`](https://github.com/css-doodle/css-doodle) - Web component for drawing patterns with CSS.
*   [`<dark-mode-toggle>`](https://github.com/GoogleChromeLabs/dark-mode-toggle) - Custom element that allows to create a dark mode toggle or switch.
*   [`<emoji-picker>`](https://github.com/nolanlawson/emoji-picker-element) - Lightweight emoji picker, distributed as a web component.
*   [`<file-viewer>`](https://github.com/avipunes/file-viewer) - Web component built with Svelte to view files.
*   [`<json-viewer>`](https://github.com/alenaksu/json-viewer) - Web component to visualize JSON data in a tree view.
*   [`<lite-youtube>`](https://github.com/paulirish/lite-youtube-embed) - Lite YouTube embed with a focus on visual performance.
*   [`<model-viewer>`](https://github.com/google/model-viewer) - Web component for rendering interactive 3D models.
*   [`<progressive-image>`](https://github.com/andreruffert/progressive-image-element) - Custom element to progressively enhance image placeholders.
*   [`<range-slider>`](https://github.com/andreruffert/range-slider-element) - Accessible range slider custom element with keyboard support.
*   [`<rapi-doc>`](https://github.com/mrin9/RapiDoc) - Web component for creating documentation from OpenAPI Specification.
*   [`<shader-doodle>`](https://github.com/halvves/shader-doodle) - Web component for writing and rendering shaders.
*   [`<trix-editor>`](https://github.com/basecamp/trix) - Rich text editor custom element for everyday writing.
*   [`<web-vitals>`](https://github.com/stefanjudis/web-vitals-element) - Bring [web vitals (‚≠ê8.1k)](https://github.com/GoogleChrome/web-vitals) quickly into your page using custom elements.
items.content_html:
Case Studies

  • Web Development At Scale: Composable Applications With Web Components

Components

  • <api-viewer> - API documentation and live playground for Web Components.
  • <chess-board> - Standalone chess board web component.
  • <css-doodle> - Web component for drawing patterns with CSS.
  • <dark-mode-toggle> - Custom element that allows to create a dark mode toggle or switch.
  • <emoji-picker> - Lightweight emoji picker, distributed as a web component.
  • <file-viewer> - Web component built with Svelte to view files.
  • <json-viewer> - Web component to visualize JSON data in a tree view.
  • <lite-youtube> - Lite YouTube embed with a focus on visual performance.
  • <model-viewer> - Web component for rendering interactive 3D models.
  • <progressive-image> - Custom element to progressively enhance image placeholders.
  • <range-slider> - Accessible range slider custom element with keyboard support.
  • <rapi-doc> - Web component for creating documentation from OpenAPI Specification.
  • <shader-doodle> - Web component for writing and rendering shaders.
  • <trix-editor> - Rich text editor custom element for everyday writing.
  • <web-vitals> - Bring web vitals (‚≠ê8.1k) quickly into your page using custom elements.
